alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Albany and Schoharie Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richmondville, or near Cobleskill, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Middleburgh, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Sharon, Seward, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, West Berne, Huntersland, Warnerville, Engleville, Gardnersville, Becker Corners, West Fulton and Shutts Corners. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
